creator: sspeiche@us.ibm.com
text:
I've downloaded the binary form and also retrieved the source and built my own 
version.  Here's what I have:

wwwrun@homerj:~/tst_apache1 > uname -a
Linux homerj 2.2.16 #1 Wed Aug 2 20:22:26 GMT 2000 i686 unknown
wwwrun@homerj:~/tst_apache1 > /usr/local/apache/bin/httpd -v
Server version: Apache/1.3.17 (Unix)
Server built:   Feb 19 2001 07:25:35
wwwrun@homerj:~/tst_apache1 > /usr/local/apache/bin/httpd -d .
Syntax error on line 22 of ./conf/httpd.conf:
API module structure `jk_module' in file 
/var/lib/wwwrun/tst_apache1/libexec/mod_jk.so is garbled - perhaps this is not 
an Apache module DSO?
wwwrun@homerj:~/tst_apache1 >

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
I have no idea what's happening - make sure the binaries are downloaded
corectly. I did installed the RPMs and had no problem so far. Probably something
wrong with your setup.

creator: sspeiche@us.ibm.com
text:
I've been to successfully build other Apache modules, Apache itself and have 
them running now (not to mention numerious other apps).  So why whould my 
problem be isolated to mod_jk?  Note that I stated that I got the problem in 
both mod_jk.so that I download and the one I built from source.  It appears to 
be an Apache API problem (possibly).  Since I not that familar w/ writing Apache 
modules, its hard to say.

What RPM's are you talking about?  I can't find any on the tomcat site.

My fault.  Turns out 'mod_jk.so' I downloaded was garbled.  When I thought I 
rebuilt it and still got the problem.  BUT there was a typo, 'mod_sk.so'.  So 
when I did a 'cp *.so libexec/.' I didn't notice.

Nevermind.  Sorry to waste your time.
creator: sspeiche@us.ibm.com
